application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

titleStmt.title: Modeling homophily and stochastic equivalence in symmetric relational data

analytic.title: Modeling homophily and stochastic equivalence in symmetric relational data

abstract.p: This article discusses a latent variable model for inference and prediction of symmetric relational data. The model, based on the idea of the eigenvalue decomposition , represents the relationship between two nodes as the weighted inner-product of node-specific vectors of latent characteristics. This "eigenmodel" generalizes other popular latent variable models, such as latent class and distance models: It is shown mathematically that any latent class or distance model has a representation as an eigenmodel, but not vice-versa. The practical implications of this are examined in the context of three real datasets, for which the eigenmodel has as good or better out-of-sample predictive performance than the other two models.
